infotexts.LoadingScreenTip: You will not get paid for delivering cargo if any of the cargo goes missing or gets damaged during the transport.
Generating more power than the devices in the submarine are consuming may damage junction boxes or cause fires.
Junction boxes and other electrical devices may get damaged if they stay submerged too long.
Letting submarine's nuclear reactor overheat may cause fires. If an overheated reactor is not shut down, it will eventually lead to a nuclear meltdown.
Most submarines are equipped with stationary batteries that can be used as a temporary source of backup power in the case of a reactor failure.
Railgun shells and depth charges include a compartment that can hold additional explosives.
Passive sonar can be used to detect nearby sound sources without attracting unwanted attention. You can also get a rough idea of your surroundings based on the sounds reflected from the ice walls.
There are many ways to get past locked doors, including forcing them open with a crowbar or rewiring them to a button you have access to.
Stationary batteries are equipped with docks that can be used to charge battery cells.
Oxygen generators are equipped with docks that can be used to refill oxygen tanks.
Supercapacitors can deliver large bursts of power, but cannot store as much energy as batteries. They are often used to power railguns and other devices that require brief bursts of high current.

Nuclear reactors are equipped with an automatic control system that adjusts the power output to a suitable level when enabled. However, the system is not always fast enough to react to large fluctuations in power consumption.
The sonar imaging on the navigation terminal may become inaccurate if the terminal is damaged - make sure your engineers keep the terminal in a good condition!
When deploying a decoy, be sure to deactivate your active sonar for best results.
Attempting to rewire powered devices without adequate electrical engineering skills may get you electrocuted.
Welding tools are simple enough to be used by any submariner, but trained mechanics are generally faster welders and have a lower risk of injuring themselves with the tool.
All submariners have been trained to do basic repairs on electrical devices, but electrical engineers get the job done much faster.
All submariners have been trained to do basic repairs on mechanical devices, but mechanics get the job done much faster.
Captains are generally much more adept at manouvering the submarine than the average sailor.

If the reactor on a sub is not able to produce sufficient power to run all onboard systems, try reducing the charge rate for the onboard batteries and supercapacitors, or regulate the times when the sub is running at full speed.

The electrical and mechanical systems on a sub will gradually degrade due to the harsh conditions and constant wear and tear. Be sure to have mechanics and engineers perform maintenance from time to time in order to avoid breakdowns at inopportune moments.
Breaking down alien artifacts in a deconstructor may provide you with exotic raw materials.

Some of the alien structures on Europa have been constructed of a metamaterial that's outstandingly resistant to physical damage, and as such has become an important subject of research to Europan scientists.
Special caution must be taken when bringing alien artifacts on board the submarine.

Very little is known of the presumably extinct alien civilization that built the ruins scattered all across Europa. The age of the ruins is also a mystery, since the self-repairing properties of the structures and devices make chronological dating methods wildly inaccurate.

No remains of the alien lifeforms that built the ruins scattered all across Europa have ever been discovered. The only life encountered inside the structures are the biomechanical entities that maintain and guard them.
While exploring ruins or caves, drop flares as often as possible to help mark a path out, should you need to make a hasty exit for some reason.
The cephalopod-like watchers are generally docile, but may attack when provoked.
Cannibalistic behavior is very common among crawlers. Killing one in a swarm may distract the rest as they enter into a feeding frenzy.
Mud raptors can easily tear their way through metal doors with their sharp beak.
The so-called husk parasites slowly take over and consume the body of their host, eventually turning them into nothing but an empty exoskeleton controlled by the parasite.
Many creatures on Europa are protected by a strong shell, and are difficult to damage with conventional weapons, though there may be weak points in their armor.
Loud devices and sonar pings may alert nearby creatures.
Performing CPR without adequate medical skills may cause internal damage to the patient.
Opiates such as morphine and fentanyl are an effective way of treating injuries in an emergency, but regular use may eventually lead to a state of addiction and cause dangerous withdrawal symptoms.
Morbusine is a neurotoxin potent enough to take down even some of the largest Europan predators. A trained medical doctor can manufacture it relatively easily using a medical fabricator.
Bleeding wounds can be treated with bandages and hemostatic agents. The patient may also need saline or blood packs to replace the lost blood.

Mental disorders such as psychosis are unfortunately common among submarine crews, particularly after ruin expeditions. If your crewmates start seeing or hearing things others don't see or hear, report it to a medical doctor immediately.
The Medical Doctors' main task is to keep the crew in a good shape, but a medic with a syringe gun and a bit of knowhow on poisons can also be very useful in fending off intruders.
Administering drugs without sufficient medical knowledge may reduce the number of doses a single syringe provides, and may also reduce the quality of the effects of the drug.
Many drugs may have unintended side effects, keep an eye on the patient and be ready to administer additional medications to counteract these side effects if necessary.
When using a diving mask, be careful not to mix up welding fuel tanks and oxygen tanks.
Diving masks let you breathe underwater, but don't offer any protection against the bone-crushing pressure outside the submarine. If there's a major hull breach, find a diving suit immediately.
In the event of a fire, burns are not the only thing to watch out for - fires can quickly consume all the oxygen inside the submarine.

Traversing the so-called Hydrothermal Wastes requires special caution. Not only are they abundant in wildlife, but the water currents caused by geothermal activity make navigation even more hazardous.
Some of the sessile lifeforms in Europa emit low-frequency sounds that may disrupt the submarine's sonar.
Be careful not to dive too deep. Most submarine hulls will start collapsing at the depth of approximately 2000 meters.
Europa is rich in natural resources, and an enterprising captain with a sharp eye and a plasma cutter may stand to make a tidy profit.
You can disguise yourself as someone else by wearing their ID card and something that covers your face.
It's possible to build voice-controlled systems by linking wifi components to the radio chat in the submarine editor.
The radiation belts around Jupiter make it impracticable to establish permanent settlements above Europa's surface, and as such almost all Europan outposts are located below its icy crust.
The dynamics of Europa's underwater ecosystem are still not fully understood, but it is believed that the base of the food chain is mostly formed by chemosynthetic bacteria.

The Europa Coalition started off as a trade and co-operation agreement between the two largest Europan settlements and a handful of private paramilitary groups, but gradually grew to become what is essentially the Europan government.
The much-ridiculed initiative to help submariners cope in a high-stress environment by including professional entertainers in the crews was promptly deemed a failure and discontinued.

Most vessels avoid venturing outside the tunnels and cracks within Europa's icy crust - the vast, empty Abyss between the surface layers and the rocky interior hosts many of Europa's largest and most dangerous inhabitants.
infotexts.PauseMenuQuitVerification: Are you sure you want to quit the game? All your unsaved progress will be lost.
infotexts.PauseMenuRetryVerification: Are you sure you want to stop the mission and load the previous save file? All your unsaved progress will be lost.
infotexts.ServerPortToolTip: The port used to communicate with clients. If clients fail to connect to your server, you may need to enable UPnP port forwarding on forward the port manually.
infotexts.ServerQueryPortToolTip: The port used to communicate with Steam's server browser and respond to info pings from clients. If clients don't see your server in the server list or if authenticating their Steam ID fails, you may need to enable UPnP port forwarding on forward the port manually.
infotexts.PublicServerToolTip: Public servers are shown in the list of available servers in the "Join Server" -tab.
infotexts.AttemptUPnPToolTip: UPnP can be used for forwarding ports on your router to allow players join the server. However, UPnP isn't supported by all routers, so you may need to setup port forwards manually if players are unable to join the server (see the readme for instructions).
infotexts.NoSubscribedMods: You haven't subscribed to any mods on the Steam Workshop. Click the "Find more mods" button below to get started!
infotexts.WorkshopItemCreateHelpText: You can use this tab to publish new items in the Steam Workshop. You can either select an existing submarine or a content package from the "Your items" menu at the left, or create an entirely new item by clicking the "Create a new item" button.
infotexts.WorkshopItemCorePackageTooltip: Core packages are special content packages that contain all the core files (executables, configuration files) the game won't run without. There must always be one (and only one) core package selected. Only select this if you wish to create a mod that replaces all the Vanilla files. Mods that only add things to the Vanilla game (or another core package) should not be marked as core packages.
infotexts.WorkshopItemChangenoteTooltip: You're publishing an update for an existing Workshop item. You can use the change note to explain what's new in the update.
infotexts.WorkshopItemDeleteTooltip: Deletes the item from Steam Workshop.
infotexts.WorkshopItemDeleteVerification: Are you sure you want to delete the item "[itemname]" from the Steam Workshop?
infotexts.WorkshopItemPublishTooltip: Uploads the files to the Steam Workshop.
infotexts.WorkshopItemFileIncluded: File will be included in the Workshop item.
infotexts.WorkshopItemFileNotIncluded: File is not present in the Workshop item folder and will not be included in the Workshop item. This may be desirable if you want the mod to use Vanilla files that the players already have - otherwise you should copy the file to the Workshop item folder.
infotexts.WorkshopItemIllegalPath: Workshop items are only allowed to modify files in the Mod folder or add submarine files to the Submarines folder. Please create a separate subfolder for the files.
infotexts.WorkshopItemRefreshFileListTooltip: Reload the configuration file of the workshop item (metadata.xml inside the item's folder) and add all new files in it to the file list.
infotexts.WorkshopItemPublished: "[itemname]" is now available in the Steam Workshop!
infotexts.WorkshopItemPublishFailed: Publishing "[itemname]" in the Steam Workshop failed.
infotexts.WorkshopItemPreviewImageDialogTitle: Select the preview image for the Steam Workshop item.
infotexts.WorkshopItemPreviewImageTooLarge: The file size of the preview image has to be less than 1 MB.

infotexts.WorkshopItemIncompatibleTooltip: This Workshop item is not compatible with your version of Barotrauma.

infotexts.EnableVSyncToolTip: Synchronizes the game's frame rate with your monitor's refresh rate. Helps prevent screen tearing artifacts.
infotexts.LightMapScaleToolTip: Lower values improve performance, but cause shadows to appear more pixellated.
infotexts.SpecularLightingToolTip: Enables specular lighting, an effect which creates brighter spots of light on shiny objects.
infotexts.ChromaticAberrationToolTip: Enables a subtle color distortion effect at the edges of the screen.
infotexts.MuteOnFocusLostToolTip: Mutes the game when its window is not in focus.
infotexts.CurrentDeviceToolTip.OSX: This device will be used for voice chat. Unfortunately there is no way to change the input device on Mac OS X and it will instead use your system's default only.
infotexts.RefreshDefaultDeviceToolTip: Refreshes the input device used for voice chat. If you swap/hotplug the default input on your system then press this to detect that change.
infotexts.VoiceMode.PushToTalkToolTip: Voice activity is sent only when a certain key is held down.
infotexts.VoiceMode.ActivityToolTip: Voice activity is sent whenever the sound coming through surpasses the noise gate threshold.
infotexts.VoipCaptureDeviceNotFound: Could not start voice capture, suitable capture device not found.
infotexts.AimAssistToolTip: Affects how close the cursor has to be to an item to highlight it. If set to 0%, the cursor has to be exactly on the item.
infotexts.EnableMouseLookToolTip: When enabled, the camera moves according to the direction you point the cursor to.
infotexts.ServerSettingsMinRespawnToolTip: What percentage of players has to be dead/spectating until a respawn shuttle is dispatched.
infotexts.ServerSettingsRespawnDurationToolTip: The amount of time respawned players have to navigate the respawn shuttle to the main submarine. After the duration expires, the shuttle will automatically head back out of the level.
infotexts.ServerSettingsUseTraitorRatio: Use % of players for max traitors

infotexts.AddSubToolTip: Places another submarine into the current submarine file. Can be used for adding things such as smaller vessels, escape pods or detachable sections into the main submarine.
infotexts.HoldToLink: Hold space and click with the mouse to link to another item.
infotexts.CharacterModeToolTip: Allows you to pick up and use items. Useful for things such as placing items inside closets, turning devices on/off and doing the wiring.
infotexts.WiringModeToolTip: Allows you to connect wires between items.
infotexts.GenerateWaypointsToolTip: AI controlled crew members require waypoints to navigate around the sub.
infotexts.SubNameMissingWarning: Name your submarine before saving it.
infotexts.ItemAssemblyNameMissingWarning: Name your item assembly before saving it.
infotexts.ItemAssemblyFileExistsWarning: There's already an item assembly with the same name. Do you want to replace the existing assembly?
infotexts.NoHullsWarning: No hulls found in the submarine. Hulls determine the "borders" of an individual room and are required for water and air distribution to work correctly.
infotexts.DisconnectedVentsWarning: The submarine contains vents which haven't been linked to an oxygen generator. Select a vent and click an oxygen generator while holding space to link them.
infotexts.DisconnectedTurretsWarning: The submarine contains [itemname]s which haven't been linked to an ammunition loader. Select the item and click a loader while holding space to link them.
infotexts.NoWaypointsWarning: No waypoints found in the submarine. AI controlled crew members won't be able to navigate without waypoints.
infotexts.NoCargoSpawnpointWarning: "The submarine does not have spawnpoints for cargo (which are used for determining where to place bought items). To fix this, create a new spawnpoint and change its "spawn type" parameter to "cargo".
infotexts.FarAwayEntitiesWarning: One or more structures/items have been placed very far from the submarine. Do you want to move the camera to them?
infotexts.AdjustLightsPrompt: This submarine was saved using an older version of Barotrauma, which used a different formula to calculate lighting. The lighting in the submarine may now appear too bright. Do you want to automatically readjust the lighting for the new lighting formula?
infotexts.AdjustedLightsNotification: The brightness of the lights has been adjusted. Areas with multiple light sources may still appear too bright and require reducing the range or brightness of the lights manually. You may also use the console command "multiplylights" to adjust the brightness of all the lights as once. For example, "multiplylights 1,1,1,0.5" would decrease the brightness by 50%.
infotexts.NoBallastTagsWarning: You should add the tag "ballast" to the ballast pumps to allow AI characters to identify which pumps are used for controlling the buoyancy of the submarine.
infotexts.NoHullNamesWarning: No names given to any of the hulls, using autogenerated names. Characters use the names to refer to different rooms when reporting things such as hull breaches.
infotexts.DeletingContainerWithItems:
A container with items inside was deleted, delete contained items as well?

Contained items:
infotexts.MirrorEntityXToolTip: Mirror the entity horizontally. You can also use the shortcut Ctrl + N.
infotexts.MirrorEntityYToolTip: Mirror the entity horizontally. You can also use the shortcut Ctrl + M.
infotexts.NonLinkedGapsWarning: The submarine contains gaps that aren't linked to any hulls. Gaps should always overlap with at least one hull (= a gap that leads outside the sub) or two hulls if it's a gap between rooms.
infotexts.CannotEditVanillaSubs: Cannot edit the submarines defined in the Vanilla content package!
infotexts.EntityDescription.hull: Hulls determine which parts are considered to be "inside the sub". Generally every room should be enclosed by a hull.
infotexts.EntityDescription.gap: Gaps allow water and air to flow between two hulls.
infotexts.EntityDescription.waypoint: Used by AI characters to navigate inside the submarine.
infotexts.EntityDescription.spawnpoint: Determines which rooms the crew spawns inside.
infotexts.EntityDescription.ff_x_wall: A large horizontal wall with collision detection
infotexts.EntityDescription.ff_x_wall_cables: A large vertical wall with collision detection
infotexts.EntityDescription.ff_y_wall: A large vertical wall with collision detection
infotexts.EntityDescription.inwalll90cables: A large vertical wall with collision detection
infotexts.EntityDescription.largehorizontalback: A decorative structure with no collision detection
infotexts.EntityDescription.smallhorizontalback: A decorative structure with no collision detection
infotexts.EntityDescription.largeverticalback: A decorative structure with no collision detection
infotexts.EntityDescription.largeverticalback2: A decorative structure with no collision detection
infotexts.EntityDescription.smallverticalback: A decorative structure with no collision detection
infotexts.EntityDescription.smallverticalback2: A decorative structure with no collision detection
infotexts.EntityDescription.CableHolderHorizontal: Decorative strip for stowing wires neatly
infotexts.EntityDescription.CableHolderVertical: Decorative strip for stowing wires neatly
infotexts.EntityDescription.largeplatform: Walkable platform which a character may optionally drop down from or climb on
infotexts.EntityDescription.platform: Walkable platform which a character may optionally drop down from or climb on
infotexts.EntityDescription.navterminal: Usable device for setting the course of the sub
infotexts.EntityDescription.shuttlenavterminal: Usable device for setting the course of the shuttle
infotexts.EntityDescription.sonarmonitor: Usable device for observing the sub's sonar. Non interactive
infotexts.EntityDescription.statusmonitor: Usable device for viewing a schematic of the sub as well as the status of each room
infotexts.EntityDescription.sonartransducer: Sonar generator, allowing the sonar monitors and navigation terminals to recieve a sonar signal other than the default one (useful for drones and remote controlled shuttles)
infotexts.EntityDescription.engine: Usable device for generating motion on the X axis
infotexts.EntityDescription.largeengine: Usable device for generating motion on the X axis
infotexts.EntityDescription.shuttleengine: Usable device for generating motion on the X axis
infotexts.EntityDescription.fabricator: A machine capable of manufacturing a wide range of items out of basic raw materials.
infotexts.EntityDescription.medicalfabricator: A machine that can be used to manufacture various medicines.
infotexts.EntityDescription.deconstructor: Disassembles and breaks down items to reusable components and material bars.
infotexts.EntityDescription.oxygenerator: Usable device for oxygen generation - must be linked to vents to work. Also recharges oxygen tanks
infotexts.EntityDescription.shuttleoxygenerator: Usable device for oxygen generation - must be linked to vents to work. Also recharges oxygen tanks
infotexts.EntityDescription.vent: Oxygen output point. Must be linked to an oxygen generator to work
infotexts.EntityDescription.reactor1: Usable device for generating electrical power
infotexts.EntityDescription.coilgun: A rapid-firing turret that propels metal bolts using electromagnets. Generally not very effective against large or heavily armored targets, but ideal for taking down smaller enemies.
infotexts.EntityDescription.coilgunloader: Feeds coilgun ammunition into a linked coilgun
infotexts.EntityDescription.depthchargetube: Deploys a depth charge or decoy
infotexts.EntityDescription.depthchargeloader: Feeds depth charges and decoys into a linked depth charge tube
infotexts.EntityDescription.dischargecoil: Produces a harmful localized electrical shock across a portion of the adjacent hull
infotexts.EntityDescription.railgun: A heavy turret that uses electromagnetic force to launch shells at very high velocities. Requires very large surges of power (usually supplied by supercapacitors) and has a low rate of fire, and as such it's most often used against large and heavily armored targets.
infotexts.EntityDescription.periscope: A device that can be used to observe the outside of the sub by connecting it to a camera, or to control weapons such as the railgun and coilgun.
infotexts.EntityDescription.railgunloader: Feeds railgun ammunition into a linked railgun
infotexts.EntityDescription.railgunloadersinglever: Feeds railgun ammunition into a linked railgun. Single shot version
infotexts.EntityDescription.railgunloadersinglehor: Feeds railgun ammunition into a linked railgun. Single shot version
infotexts.EntityDescription.idcard: Allows limited access to areas of the sub
infotexts.EntityDescription.alienpistol: A handgun powered by alien power cells
infotexts.EntityDescription.captainscap: A token of the Captain's unquestionable authority.
infotexts.EntityDescription.captainsuniform: Makes you look like you might be in charge
infotexts.EntityDescription.healthscanner: A heads-up display that displays information of the vital signs and status of nearby humans.
infotexts.EntityDescription.doctorsuniform: Makes you look like you might be useful in a medical emergency
infotexts.EntityDescription.orangejumpsuit: The fire-resistant fabric offers some protection against fires.
infotexts.EntityDescription.bluejumpsuit: The fire-resistant fabric offers some protection against fires.
infotexts.EntityDescription.toolbox: A portable container for storing tools
infotexts.EntityDescription.headset: Allows remote communication between the crew.
infotexts.EntityDescription.watchmanclothes: Makes you look like you might offer a mission to passerby at any moment
infotexts.EntityDescription.bodyarmor: While the body armor won't offer adequate protection against most of the inhabitants of the subsurface ocean, it can be extremely useful if there are traitors on board.
infotexts.EntityDescription.ballistichelmet: While the helmet won't offer adequate protection against most of the inhabitants of the subsurface ocean, it can be extremely useful if there are traitors on board.
infotexts.EntityDescription.divingmask: Small enough to carry around in case of need, but won't protect you from the water pressure in the event of a full-blown hull breach.
infotexts.EntityDescription.divingsuit: An atmospheric diving suit capable of withstanding the immense pressure under Europa's crust.
infotexts.EntityDescription.antibleeding1: Basic bandages, useful in the treatment of bleeding wounds and burns.
infotexts.EntityDescription.antibleeding2: A synthetic skin with hemostatic properties, able to quickly seal most wounds.
infotexts.EntityDescription.antibleeding3: An antibiotic glue with hemostatic properties. Seals bleeding wounds almost immediately and treats burns very effectively. Use with care as it may cause mobile clots in the bloodstream.
infotexts.EntityDescription.weldingtool: One of the most crucial tools on board the submarine. Also works underwater.
infotexts.EntityDescription.plasmacutter: Cuts through various materials using a jet of ionized oxygen.
infotexts.EntityDescription.screwdriver: Makes electrical repairs and rewiring possible
infotexts.EntityDescription.crowbar: Forces doors and hatches open, also a blunt weapon
infotexts.EntityDescription.sonarbeacon: Produces a localized signal that can be detected on by a sonar monitor, handheld sonar, or navigation terminal
infotexts.EntityDescription.flare: Temporary handheld light. Useful for marking a path while exploring outside the sub
infotexts.EntityDescription.alienflare: Temporary handheld light. Useful for marking a path while exploring outside the sub. Burns for longer than a regular flare.
infotexts.EntityDescription.uex: A simple explosive compound made of sodium and phosphorus.
infotexts.EntityDescription.ic4block: A compound made of C-4 and incendium.
infotexts.EntityDescription.detonator: A device that detonates any contained explosive when receiving a signal.
infotexts.EntityDescription.spear: A harpoon for the harpoon gun
infotexts.EntityDescription.alienspear: A harpoon for the harpoon gun, made of alien material
infotexts.EntityDescription.explosivespear: A harpoon for the harpoon gun
infotexts.EntityDescription.harpoongun: Launches harpoons, explosive harpoons, and alien harpoons
infotexts.EntityDescription.syringegun: Launches syrettes containing drugs or poisons
infotexts.EntityDescription.stungrenade: Produces bright light and a loud sound on detonation, which stuns nearby characters
infotexts.EntityDescription.fraggrenade: General purpose fragmentation grenade. Use carefully
infotexts.EntityDescription.stunbaton: If verbal orders are insufficient, a high-voltage shock from a Stun Baton may be enough to beat an unruly crew member into submission.
infotexts.EntityDescription.batterycell: Used as a power source for various handheld devices. Most submarines have several stationary backup batteries with recharge docks for battery cells.
infotexts.EntityDescription.fulguriumbatterycell: A battery cell constructed of the rare and poorly understood compound Fulgurium.
infotexts.EntityDescription.junctionbox: Serves as a hub for power distribution and relaying signals between devices.
infotexts.EntityDescription.battery: Generally used for storing backup power in case of a reactor failure.
infotexts.EntityDescription.shuttlebattery: Generally used for storing backup power in case of a reactor failure.
infotexts.EntityDescription.supercapacitor: Can deliver charge much faster than batteries.
infotexts.EntityDescription.chargingdock: A wall-mounted battery cell charging dock.
infotexts.EntityDescription.fpgacircuit: Field-programmable gate array - a multi-purpose circuit which can be reconfigured for use in a large variety of electrical devices.
infotexts.EntityDescription.andcomponent: Sends a signal when both inputs receive a signal within a set period of each other.
infotexts.EntityDescription.addercomponent: Outputs the sum of the received signals.
infotexts.EntityDescription.orcomponent: Sends a signal if either of the inputs receive a signal.
infotexts.EntityDescription.notcomponent: Sends a signal when the input is NOT receiving a signal.
infotexts.EntityDescription.relaycomponent: When switched on, forwards all received signals from the input connections to the outputs.
infotexts.EntityDescription.delaycomponent: Delays all received signals for a specific amount of time.
infotexts.EntityDescription.oxygendetector: Sends out a value between 0-100 depending on the quality of the surrounding air.
infotexts.EntityDescription.waterdetector: Sends out a signal when the detector is submerged.
infotexts.EntityDescription.smokedetector: Sends out a signal when it senses smoke.
infotexts.EntityDescription.motiondetector: Sends out a signal when it detects movement.
infotexts.EntityDescription.signalcheckcomponent: Sends a signal when a signal matching a specific value is received.
infotexts.EntityDescription.regexcomponent: Sends a signal if the received signal matches a specific regular expression pattern.
infotexts.EntityDescription.equalscomponent: Sends a signal when both inputs receive the same signal.
infotexts.EntityDescription.greatercomponent: Sends a signal if the value the signal_in1 input is larger than the signal_in2 input.
infotexts.EntityDescription.colorcomponent: Outputs a combined color signal for light control.
infotexts.EntityDescription.subtractcomponent: Outputs the subtracted value of the received signals.
infotexts.EntityDescription.multiplycomponent: Outputs the product of the received signals.
infotexts.EntityDescription.dividecomponent: Outputs the divided value of the received signals.
infotexts.EntityDescription.xorcomponent: Sends a signal if either of the inputs, but not both, receives a signal.
infotexts.EntityDescription.memorycomponent: Outputs a stored value that can be updated from other sources. Use the signal_in connection to set the stored value, and the signal_store input to toggle whether the received signals should be stored.
infotexts.EntityDescription.oscillator: Sends out a periodic, oscillating signal.
infotexts.EntityDescription.wificomponent: Allows remote communication between other Wifi Components that are using the same channel.
infotexts.EntityDescription.camera: Typically used in photonics masts to provide the crew with a high-resolution view of the area outside the sub.
infotexts.EntityDescription.button: Produces a signal which can be used to toggle the state equipment and doors
infotexts.EntityDescription.switch: Produces a constant signal which can be used to change the state of equipment and doors
infotexts.EntityDescription.emergencylight: Wall mounted lighting, requires no electrical input
infotexts.EntityDescription.wire: Connects an output from one piece of equipment to an input on another
infotexts.EntityDescription.redwire: Connects an output from one piece of equipment to an input on another
infotexts.EntityDescription.bluewire: Connects an output from one piece of equipment to an input on another
infotexts.EntityDescription.orangewire: Connects an output from one piece of equipment to an input on another
infotexts.EntityDescription.greenwire: Connects an output from one piece of equipment to an input on another
infotexts.EntityDescription.blackwire: Connects an output from one piece of equipment to an input on another
infotexts.EntityDescription.brownwire: Connects an output from one piece of equipment to an input on another
infotexts.EntityDescription.lightcomponent: General purpose lighting. Requires no electrical input
infotexts.EntityDescription.emergencysiren: Can be triggered to make a terrible noise
infotexts.EntityDescription.alarmbuzzer: Can be triggered to make a terrible noise
infotexts.EntityDescription.alienblood: Blood extracted from an Europan lifeform. Can be further processed into a blood substitute for the treatment of blood loss.
infotexts.EntityDescription.huskeggs: Dormant eggs of the Europan lifeform colloquially referred to as 'husk parasite'.
infotexts.EntityDescription.carbon: Most commonly used in the manufacture of steel and plastic.
infotexts.EntityDescription.iron: Can be used in the manufacture of simple tools, or refined into steel by mixing it with carbon.
infotexts.EntityDescription.tin: Most commonly used in the manufacture of various electrical components.
infotexts.EntityDescription.lead: Most commonly used in the manufacture of various types of ammunition.
infotexts.EntityDescription.phosphorus: Used in the manufacture of lamps, explosives and some medical compounds.
infotexts.EntityDescription.copper: Most commonly used in the manufacture of electrical wiring.
infotexts.EntityDescription.zinc: Most commonly used in the manufacture of batteries and tonic liquid.
infotexts.EntityDescription.sodium: Medical fabricators can combine sodium and chloride to create a saline solution, which can be used as a treatment for blood loss or as an ingredient for more complex medicine.
infotexts.EntityDescription.silicon: Used as an ingredient in aluminium alloys, plastic and various electrical components.
infotexts.EntityDescription.uranium: Can be refined in a fabricator to create fuel rods for a nuclear reactor, or used in the manufacture of nuclear weapons.
infotexts.EntityDescription.potassium: Used in the manufacture of explosives and medical compounds. Reacts violently when in contact with water.
infotexts.EntityDescription.magnesium: Used in the manufacture of explosives and medical compounds. Reacts violently when in contact with water.
infotexts.EntityDescription.lithium: Most commonly used in the manufacture of batteries and antipsychotic drugs.
infotexts.EntityDescription.chlorine: Most commonly used saline, a common treatment for blood loss, and chloral hydrate, a powerful sedative.
infotexts.EntityDescription.slimebacteria: A colony of myxobacteria. Can be processed into antibiotics.
infotexts.EntityDescription.titanite: A mineral containing titanium and iron.
infotexts.EntityDescription.brockite: A mineral containing titanium and phosphorus.
infotexts.EntityDescription.amblygonite: A mineral composed of lithium, aluminium and sodium.
infotexts.EntityDescription.sphalerite: A mineral consisting largely of zinc in crystalline form.
infotexts.EntityDescription.quartz: A crystalline mineral composed of silicon.
infotexts.EntityDescription.diamond: A crystal composed of solid carbon.
infotexts.EntityDescription.hydroxyapatite: A mineral composed of calcium and phosphorus.
infotexts.EntityDescription.uraniumore: A mineral containing large concentrations of uranium.
infotexts.EntityDescription.stannite: A mineral composed of copper, iron and tin.
infotexts.EntityDescription.esperite: A mineral composed of zinc and lead.
infotexts.EntityDescription.galena: A mineral mostly consisting of lead.
infotexts.EntityDescription.langbeinite: A mineral consisting of potassium and magnesium.
infotexts.EntityDescription.chamosite: A mineral consisting of iron and aluminium.
infotexts.EntityDescription.ironore: A mineral containing large amounts of iron.
infotexts.EntityDescription.polyhalite: A mineral consisting of potassium and calcium.
infotexts.EntityDescription.sylvite: A mineral containing potassium and sodium.
infotexts.EntityDescription.lazulite: A mineral containing phosphorus and iron.
infotexts.EntityDescription.opium: A relatively mild opioid obtained from Aquatic Poppy. Most commonly used to manufacture morphine and fentanyl.
infotexts.EntityDescription.antibiotics: A mild antibiotic that acts against a wide range of disease-causing bacteria, though with side effect of internal damage. Used as an ingredient in many medical compounds.
infotexts.EntityDescription.stabilozine: Used as an ingredient in the manufacture of various medicines. On its own, can be mildly useful in the treatment of internal damage and burns, and slightly more effectively for oxygen deprivation.
infotexts.EntityDescription.ethanol: Medical alcohol used as an ingredient in the manufacture of various medicines. Drinking while on duty is not advised.
infotexts.EntityDescription.sulphuricacid: A strong acid that causes burns when in contact with skin. Used as an ingredient in several poisons.
infotexts.EntityDescription.antidama1: A powerful opiate for treating pain associated with internal injuries, but will cause shortness of breath and eventual dependency with overuse.
infotexts.EntityDescription.antidama2: A powerful opiate for treating pain associated with internal injuries, but will cause shortness of breath and eventual dependency with overuse.
infotexts.EntityDescription.antibloodloss1: A sodium chloride infusion mildly useful in the treatment of blood loss.
infotexts.EntityDescription.antibloodloss2: A pack of blood substitute for the treatment of blood loss.
infotexts.EntityDescription.deusizine: A highly potent stimulant effective in the treatment of internal damage, oxygen deprivation and to a lesser extent, blood loss. Produces mild burns as a side effect.
infotexts.EntityDescription.calyxanide: An antiparasitic drug used in the treatment of husk parasite infections. Might require higher dosage to cure the infection at later stages.
infotexts.EntityDescription.antinarc: An opioid antagonist for the treatment of opiate based withdrawal and overdose.
infotexts.EntityDescription.morbusineantidote: An antidote for acute morbusine poisoning.
infotexts.EntityDescription.liquidoxygenite: A mildy toxic solution that slowly releases oxygen into the bloodstream when injected. Avoid dropping.
infotexts.EntityDescription.tonicliquid: A medical solution that's mildy effective as a treatment for internal damage, but most commonly used as an ingredient in more complex medical compounds.
infotexts.EntityDescription.steroids: Temporarily increases muscular strength and physical performance.
infotexts.EntityDescription.hyperzine: An extremely potent muscle stimulant for those moments when you gotta go fast.
infotexts.EntityDescription.chloralhydrate: A sedative that can be used to knock someone out for a short period of time.
infotexts.EntityDescription.nitroglycerin: A highly unstable liquid that may explode when subjected to heat or physical shock.
infotexts.EntityDescription.fiberplant: The plant has the texture of a coconut and its fibers move on their own under your fingers unnervingly. Useful for crafting
infotexts.EntityDescription.elastinplant: The foliage of this plant cannot be torn, only stretched. Useful for crafting
infotexts.EntityDescription.aquaticpoppy: It's warm to the touch. Useful for crafting
infotexts.EntityDescription.yeastshroom: The smell is beyond belief, like rotting meat on a hot day. Useful for crafting
infotexts.EntityDescription.elastin: A highly elastic, naturally occuring protein Useful for crafting
infotexts.EntityDescription.adrenaline: A naturally occuring hormone. Useful for crafting
infotexts.EntityDescription.swimbladder: Many Europan lifeforms have a swim bladder containing tissue fluids that can be easily processed into stabilozine and saline.
infotexts.EntityDescription.adrenalinegland: Contains large amounts of adrenaline, which can be extracted using a deconstructor.
infotexts.EntityDescription.suppliescabinet: Storage for small and medium sized items
infotexts.EntityDescription.mediumsteelcabinet: Storage for small and medium sized items
infotexts.EntityDescription.mediumwindowedsteelcab: Storage for small and medium sized items
infotexts.EntityDescription.steelcabinet: Storage for small and medium sized items
infotexts.EntityDescription.securesteelcabinet: Lockable storage for small and medium sized items
infotexts.EntityDescription.railgunshellrack: A way to neatly stow railgun shells
infotexts.EntityDescription.coilgunammoshelf: A way to neatly stow coilgun ammunition
infotexts.EntityDescription.divingsuitlocker: A diving suit locker with one dive-ready suit.
infotexts.EntityDescription.metalcrate: A vessel in which items may be stored
infotexts.EntityDescription.securemetalcrate: A secure vessel in which items may be stored
infotexts.EntityDescription.explosivecrate: A vessel in which explosives may be stored
infotexts.EntityDescription.chemicalcrate: A vessel in which chemicals may be stored
infotexts.EntityDescription.extinguisherbracket: Holds a fire extinguisher to the wall
infotexts.EntityDescription.weaponholder: A place to stow your weapons neatly
infotexts.EntityDescription.dockingport: A vertically aligned docking interface. Locks to another Docking port to form a water tight seal and allow passage between subs, shuttles and locations
infotexts.EntityDescription.dockinghatch: A horizontally aligned docking interface. Locks to another Docking hatch to form a water tight seal and allow passage between subs, shuttles and locations
infotexts.EntityDescription.ductblock: A mechanically operated vent which may be opened or closed to allow the passage of water
infotexts.EntityName.label: Label
infotexts.EntityDescription.label: Decorative text label
infotexts.EntityDescription.fuelrod: A rod of enriched uranium, for use within a reactor
infotexts.EntityDescription.fulguriumfuelrod: A rod of enriched fulgurium, for use within a reactor. Generates significantly more heat and lasts longer than uranium fuel rods.
infotexts.EntityDescription.thoriumfuelrod: A thorium bar, for use within a reactor. Generates slightly more heat and lasts longer than uranium fuel rods.
infotexts.EntityDescription.depthchargeshell: A barrel of explosives. Will sink and then explode
infotexts.EntityDescription.nucleardepthcharge: A barrel of really big explosives. Will sink and then explode
infotexts.EntityDescription.depthdecoyshell: A decoy which can be depoloyed via the depth charge launcher. Will sink while producing a loud accoustic signal to attract attention away from the sub
infotexts.EntityDescription.nucleardepthdecoy: A decoy which can be depoloyed via the depth charge launcher. Will sink while producing a loud accoustic signal to attract attention away from the sub
infotexts.EntityDescription.nuclearshell: A nuclear shell for use with a railgun
infotexts.EntityDescription.RuinWallHorizontal: A basic wall with collision for alien ruins.
infotexts.EntityDescription.RuinWallVertical: A basic wall with collision for alien ruins.
infotexts.EntityDescription.RuinWallHeavyHorizonta: A heavy wall with collision for alien ruins.
infotexts.EntityDescription.RuinWallHeavyVertical: A heavy wall with collision for alien ruins.
infotexts.EntityDescription.RuinWallHorizontalSmal: A small wall with collision for alien ruins.
infotexts.EntityDescription.RuinWallVerticalSmall: A small wall with collision for alien ruins.
infotexts.EntityDescription.RuinBack: A back wall for alien ruins.
infotexts.EntityDescription.RuinBackCarvings: A back wall with carven symbols for alien ruins.
infotexts.EntityDescription.RuinBackFractal: A back wall with fractal pattern for alien ruins.
infotexts.EntityDescription.RuinBlock: A decorative prop for alien ruins.
infotexts.EntityDescription.RuinFractalBall: A decorative prop for alien ruins.
infotexts.EntityDescription.RuinClaw: A decorative prop for alien ruins.
infotexts.EntityDescription.alientrinket1: Minor artifact found in alien ruins.
infotexts.EntityDescription.alientrinket2: Minor artifact found in alien ruins.
infotexts.EntityDescription.alientrinket3: Minor artifact found in alien ruins.
infotexts.EntityDescription.alienhatch: A horizontal hatch for alien ruins.
infotexts.EntityDescription.aliendoor: A vertical door for alien ruins.
infotexts.EntityDescription.alienmotionsensor: A motion detector used by aliens.
infotexts.EntityDescription.aliengenerator: Converts alien power cells to electricity.
infotexts.EntityDescription.alienpump: Used to pump water in and out of ruins.
infotexts.EntityDescription.alienbutton: Sends a signal to alien mechanisms.
infotexts.EntityDescription.alienturret: A stationary turret found in alien ruins.
infotexts.EntityDescription.aliencoil: Discharges electricity, used in alien ruins.
infotexts.EntityDescription.alienlightcomponent: Emits light, used in alien ruins.
infotexts.EntityDescription.automateddockinghatch: A docking hatch with a circuit that automatically opens the hatch when docked, and closes the hatch when undocking (with a delay that prevents deattaching while the hatch is still closing)
infotexts.EntityDescription.automaticdoor: A door that closes automatically after 5 seconds if there's no-one in the doorway.
infotexts.EntityDescription.automatichatch: A hatch that closes automatically in 5 seconds if there's no-one in the way.
infotexts.EntityDescription.automaticwindoweddoor: A door that closes automatically after 5 seconds if there's no-one in the doorway.
infotexts.EntityDescription.largedivinggearcabinet: A cabinet loaded with diving masks, oxygen tanks, underwater scooters, handheld sonars and flares.
infotexts.EntityDescription.largedivingsuitcabinet: A cabinet with 5 dive-ready diving suits and 10 oxygen tanks
infotexts.EntityDescription.smalldivinggearcabinet: A cabinet with diving masks, underwater scooters and handheld sonars.
