infotexts.Submarine.Description.Humpback: A former military vessel, WH4-L3 "Humpback" has been outfitted to withstand most of the dangers in deep Europa. Her relatively high velocity is offset by low maneuverability. Still boasting an older model reactor, power needs to be supplemented by a backup battery array or the crew will find themselves unable to run all of the new equipment.
infotexts.Submarine.Description.Bunyip: Latest in the line of personnel transports, Bunyip is capable of ferrying crew between submarines and installations. Its operating radius is considerably lower than its more advanced cousins and no weapons on board make it vulnerable to attacks.
infotexts.Submarine.Description.Muikku: The workhorse of the colonies, these little shuttles have good speed and dive/ascent characteristics, but they are fragile and their low capacity batteries limit their range somewhat.
infotexts.Submarine.Description.Orca: With a relatively high top speed and fantastic ascent and descent characteristics due to her 3 large ballast tanks, Orca class subs are agile vessels, let down only by their small compliment of weapons, unreliable engine and reactors with a greater than average hunger for fuel.
infotexts.Submarine.Description.Remora: A range of customization options are available for Remora. In this model, some of the main hull space has been replaced by a detachable ballast and a remote-controlled drone. A large crew is needed to operate this submarine.
infotexts.Submarine.Description.Typhon: Typhon class subs are known for their brutish appearance, reasonable array of light and heavy firepower, and their general dependability. Any captain should be aware of their poor rate of descent and unimpressive top speed.
infotexts.Submarine.Description.Dugong: Compared to larger vessels, the Dugong series is outshadowed by all aspects except one: their reliability for their price is world class. They're lacking in firepower and speed, so smart maneuvering is key.
infotexts.Submarine.Description.Selkie: The workhorse of the colonies, these little shuttles have good speed and dive/ascent characteristics, but they are fragile and their low capacity batteries limit their range somewhat.
infotexts.Submarine.Description.Venture: Originally intended as research vessels, Venture shuttles have been co-opted as a more robust alternative for travel between outposts and submarines.
infotexts.LinkWaypoint: Hold space to link to another waypoint
infotexts.IDCardDescriptionTooltip: Characters spawning at this spawnpoint will have the specified description added to their ID card. This can be used to describe additional access levels their card has on the sub.
infotexts.IDCardTagsTooltip: Characters spawning at this spawnpoint will have the specified tags added to their ID card. You can, for example, use these tags to limit access to some parts of the sub.
infotexts.SpawnpointJobsTooltip: Only characters with the specified job will spawn at this spawnpoint.
infotexts.ReloadLinkedSubTooltip: Reload the linked submarine from the specified file
infotexts.LinkLinkedSub: Hold space to link to a docking port
infotexts.SpamFilterKicked: You have been kicked by the spam filter.
infotexts.SpamFilterBlocked: You have been blocked by the spam filter. Try again after 10 seconds.
infotexts.ReactorTipFissionRate: Increasing the fission rate makes the reactor consume more fuel and generate more heat. The heat is used to spin the turbine which generates electricity.
infotexts.ReactorTipTurbineOutput: The higher the turbine output, the more the reactor attempts to generate electricity. If the output is too high relative to the fission rate, the reactor will cool down, and if too low, it will overheat.
infotexts.ReactorTipTemperature: The temperature of the reactor core. The temperature is optimal when the bar is between the red indicators.
infotexts.ReactorTipLoad: How much power is currently being consumed by the devices connected to the reactor.
infotexts.ReactorTipPower: How much power is currently being generated by the reactor.
infotexts.ReactorTipAutoTemp: When automatic control is on, the reactor will automatically adjust itself according to the power consumption. However, the system is not fast enough to react to large fluctuations in power consumption, so manual adjustments may still be needed.
infotexts.SteeringAutoPilotMaintainPosTip: AUTOPILOT ON\nMaintaining position. Choose the position to maintain by clicking on the display.
infotexts.SteeringAutoPilotLocationTip: AUTOPILOT ON\nAutopilot is set to navigate towards [locationname].
infotexts.SonarTipActive: When active sonar is on, the transponders send out pings that reflect from nearby obstacles. The pings may also be heard by hostile creatures or enemy submarines.
infotexts.SonarTipPassive: In passive mode, the sonar only listens to sources of sound and sounds reflected from nearby obstacles without actively sending out pings.
infotexts.PowerTransferTipOvervoltage: When the electrical grid is supplied more power than what is being consumed, the voltage rises which may cause damage to electrical devices.
infotexts.PowerTransferTipLowvoltage: When there's not enough power available, the voltage drops which may cause some devices to shut down.
infotexts.PowerTransferTipLoad: How much power is currently being consumed by the devices connected to the electrical grid.
infotexts.PowerTransferTipPower: How much power is currently being supplied to the electrical grid.
infotexts.HealthItemUseTip: Drop items here to use them on the selected limb. You can also use items with the inventory hotkeys or by double clicking.
infotexts.LowMedicalSkillWarning: Low medical skill! The suitable treatment list may be inaccurate.
infotexts.HealthLimbName.Head: Head
infotexts.TraitorStartMessage: You are the Traitor! Your secret task is to assassinate [targetname]! Discretion is an utmost concern; sinking the submarine and killing the entire crew will arouse suspicion amongst the Fleet. If possible, make the death look like an accident.
infotexts.TraitorMoreAgentsMessage:
It is possible that there are other agents on this submarine. You don't know their names, but you do have a method of communication. Use the code words to greet the agent and code response to respond. Disguise such words in a normal-looking phrase so the crew doesn't suspect anything.

The code words are: [codewords].
The code response is: [coderesponse].
infotexts.TraitorStartMessageServer: [traitorname] is the traitor and the target is [targetname].
infotexts.TraitorEndMessageSuccess: [traitorname] was a traitor! [Genderpronounpossessive] task was to assassinate [targetname]. The task was successful.
infotexts.TraitorEndMessageSuccessTraitorDead: [traitorname] was a traitor! [Genderpronounpossessive] task was to assassinate [targetname]. The task was successful, but the traitor did not make it out alive either.
infotexts.TraitorEndMessageSuccessTraitorDetained: [traitorname] was a traitor! [Genderpronounpossessive] task was to assassinate [targetname]. The task was successful, but the traitor was succesfully detained.
infotexts.TraitorEndMessageFailure: [traitorname] was a traitor! [Genderpronounpossessive] task was to assassinate [targetname]. The task was unsuccessful.
infotexts.TraitorEndMessageFailureTraitorDead: [traitorname] was a traitor! [Genderpronounpossessive] task was to assassinate [targetname], but [genderpronoun] got [genderpronounreflexive] killed before completing it.
infotexts.TraitorEndMessageFailureTraitorDetained: [traitorname] was a traitor! [Genderpronounpossessive] task was to assassinate [targetname]. The task failed - [genderpronoun] was successfully detained.
infotexts.Self_CauseOfDeathDescription.Damage: You have succumbed to your injuries.
infotexts.Self_CauseOfDeathDescription.Pressure: You have been crushed by water pressure.
infotexts.Self_CauseOfDeathDescription.Husk: The parasite has taken over your body.
infotexts.Self_CauseOfDeathDescription.Disconnecte: You were disconnected from the server.
infotexts.GiveInHelpMultiplayer: Let go of your character and enter spectator mode (other players will no longer be able to revive you)
infotexts.GiveInHelpSingleplayer: The character can no longer be revived if you give in.
infotexts.DeathChatNotification: Your chat messages will only be visible to other dead players.
infotexts.DialogReactorFuel: Loading more fuel to the reactor!
infotexts.DialogReactorTaken: Hands off please, I've got this!
Hey, we don't need two people at the reactor!
infotexts.DialogCantFindController: I can't find a way to operate the [item]!
I don't know how to control the [item]!
infotexts.DialogNoBatteries: There aren't any batteries on this boat!
infotexts.DialogLeakFixed: Repairing [roomname], a few more holes to go!
infotexts.DialogGetDivingGear: Need to find a diving suit!
infotexts.DialogGetOxygenTank: Need to find an oxygen tank!
infotexts.DialogNoFire: I don't think there's any fire to put out!
infotexts.DialogSteeringTaken: Hey, I'm at the helm now!
Hands off please, I'm steering now!
Hey, we don't need two people to steer!
infotexts.DialogSonarTarget: A target on the sonar at [direction]!
A blip on the sonar at [direction]!
infotexts.DialogSonarTargetLarge: A large target on the sonar at [direction]!
Something big on the sonar at [direction]!
infotexts.OrderDialogSelf.operatereactor: I'll take care of the reactor!
infotexts.OrderDialog.steer.navigatetodestination: [name], set the course to our destination!
infotexts.OrderDialog.chargebatteries.charge: [name], make sure all batteries are charged!
infotexts.OrderDialog.rescue: [name], give medical aid to anyone in need!
infotexts.OrderDialogSelf.rescue: I'll give medical aid to anyone in need!
infotexts.OrderDialogSelf.repairsystems: I'll take care of broken devices!
infotexts.OrderDialogSelf.repairsystems.jobspecifi: I'll take care of broken devices!
infotexts.OrderDialog.repairsystems.all: [name], repair any damaged systems! I don't care if you don't have the skills, do your best!
[name], try to fix any broken devices, even if it's something you're not trained for!
[name], repair any damaged devices! Anything you can, I don't care about your training now!
infotexts.OrderDialogSelf.repairsystems.all: I'll take care of broken devices!
infotexts.OrderDialog.reportbrokendevices: Need someone to repair devices in [roomname]!
infotexts.HuskDormant: It feels as if something was stuck in your throat
infotexts.HuskCantSpeak: You feel something moving in your throat. You try to scream but no sound comes out.
infotexts.HuskActivate: A strange chitinous appendage bursts out from your mouth. Use it to inject eggs into a living body by pressing [Attack]!
infotexts.WelcomeText: Welcome aboard 'captain'. We'll be plain with you: We don't think much of you, and we don't think you have what it takes to command this fine vessel or us, its crew, through these hellish waters. What does a child of privilege from the colonies with an inherited sub know of survival way out there in the dark and the cold? Regardless, it seems this is how things are going to be... for now, and we need to get you making decisions that at least won't get us all killed immediately, although that might be a small mercy... Listen well when we have something to say, or you'll be taking a swim with the gulper fishes, the waitawhile, the mantises and god knows what else, you hear?
infotexts.ReactorCommandObjective: Give the order to power up the reactor
infotexts.NavConsoleText: Now that we have power, let's get her moving. Go attend to the navigation console and activate the ship's sonar so we can see where we're going. After that, we can safely undock and set the course to {0}.
infotexts.NavConsoleInstructions:
-Use the Navigation Terminal
-Set sonar to "active"
-Press the button to undock
-While on manual steering, click on sonar UI to set course
infotexts.DestinationObjectiveText: Wonders will never cease! You managed to get us underway. You're still fresh meat, though 'captain', and we still need to make it to {0}... don't screw this up.
infotexts.FloodText: We're taking water! Find somebody who knows what they're doing and start welding before we're completely screwed.
infotexts.FloodInstructions: -Click on crew list to switch control to mechanic\n-Equip welding torch\n-Right mouse button to aim, left click to fire
infotexts.ReactorUseInstructions: -Left gauge controls the amount of power generated\n-Right gauge controls the amount of it sent to rest of the submarine\n-Try to keep both gauges green for a balanced power output
infotexts.EnemyOnSonarText: Captain, we have a bogey on our sonar. Knowing these waters, it can't be anything too friendly. Order somebody to man the turret, preferably someone with some weapons know-how. Failing that, do it yourself. It's kill or be killed down here.
infotexts.EnemyOnSonarInstructions: -Use the periscope\n-Right mouse button to aim, left click to fire
infotexts.DegradingText: This vessel, she's a delicate thing and her systems tend to break down over time without maintenance! Any captain worth their salt would know this.
infotexts.DegradingObjective: Order the crew to perform maintenance
infotexts.MedicalText: Captain! {0} is hurt. We should have somebody tend to {1} injuries or we risk losing them.
infotexts.MedicalInstructions:
-Highlight a crewmember
-Press H to enter health interface
-Select injured limb
-Drag medical supplies into highlighted area to treat
infotexts.Approach1Text: We are close to {0}! Carefully now, we should be slowing down so we don't ram them. Maneuver the sub close to their docking port and close the clamps when we're there.
infotexts.Approach1Instructions: -Maneuver so that the docking ports are close to each other\n-When docking line is green, toggle docking clamps
infotexts.Approach2Text: Well now, looks like Captain Fresh Meat here has gained a little salt! You managed to get us to where we were going, but don't let that go to your head, you're still way out of your depth here, but maybe you can learn... maybe we do stand a chance.
infotexts.AfflictionDescription.InternalDamage: The area is an ugly shade of purple, and apparently very painful to touch. You suspect a bone might be broken.
infotexts.AfflictionCauseOfDeathSelf.InternalDamag: You have succumbed to your internal injuries.
infotexts.AfflictionDescription.Bleeding: Blood pours freely from this ragged and particularly nasty open wound.
infotexts.AfflictionDescription.Burn: The area is blistered and red, and skin is already beginning to peel away in sheets. The patient is in a great deal of pain.
infotexts.AfflictionDescription.OxygenLow: The skin is pale and clammy, and the lips turning blue.
infotexts.AfflictionDescription.Bloodloss: The patient is pale and cold. Their heart beats in an alarmingly rapid fashion.
infotexts.AfflictionDescription.Stun: The patient is dazed and unresponsive.
infotexts.AfflictionDescription.Pressure: There is obvious massive organ damage and the blood vessels of the eye have burst, creating an unnerving red gaze.
infotexts.AfflictionCauseOfDeathSelf.Pressure: You have been crushed by water pressure.
infotexts.AfflictionDescription.HuskInfection: Something dark and unpleasant moves in the mouth. They are rendered completely mute, save for occasional clicking sounds apparently emanating from deep within the throat.
infotexts.AfflictionCauseOfDeath.HuskInfection: Taken over by a husk parasite.
infotexts.AfflictionCauseOfDeathSelf.HuskInfection: You have been taken over by the husk parasite.
infotexts.AfflictionDescription.Psychosis: The patient rants and mutters in an agitated fashion, a steady commentary of unseen events.
infotexts.AfflictionDescription.Drunk: The smell of alcohol rises from them like a vapor, their speech slurs a little, and their eyes fail to focus.
infotexts.AfflictionCauseOfDeathSelf.Drunk: You have died of alcohol poisoning.
infotexts.AfflictionDescription.OpiateWithdrawal: Agitation and a tremor are obvious, as are the signs of nausea.
infotexts.AfflictionCauseOfDeathSelf.OpiateWithdra: You have died of opiate withdrawal.
infotexts.AfflictionDescription.OpiateOverdose: The patient has pinpoint pupils and icy cold skin. They struggle to breathe and swallow.
infotexts.AfflictionCauseOfDeathSelf.OpiateOverdos: You have died of opiate overdose.
infotexts.AfflictionDescription.OpiateAddiction: The patient is happy enough... so long as they get what they need.
infotexts.AfflictionDescription.GunshotWound: The entry site is a small, dark, bruised hole oozing a little blood. The exit wound however is a large ragged mess of exposed tissue and pouring blood.
infotexts.AfflictionCauseOfDeathSelf.GunshotWound: You have died of gunshot wounds.
infotexts.AfflictionDescription.MorbusinePoisoning: The patient can't breathe at all, and their heartrate is slowing rapidly.
infotexts.AfflictionCauseOfDeathSelf.MorbusinePois: You have died of morbusine poisoning.
infotexts.AfflictionDescription.SufforinPoisoning: Without prompt treatment, sufforine poisoning leads to delusions and rapid death.
infotexts.AfflictionCauseOfDeathSelf.SufforinPoiso: You have died of sufforin poisoning.
infotexts.AfflictionDescription.CyanidePoisoning: The patient is confused and has trouble breathing. Their skin is red and they have occasional muscle spasms.
infotexts.AfflictionCauseOfDeathSelf.CyanidePoison: You have died of cyanide poisoning.
infotexts.AfflictionDescription.Haste: Movement speed and reflexes are heightened.
infotexts.AfflictionDescription.HuskInfectionResis: Patient's immune system is more attuned to alien parasites.
infotexts.AfflictionDescription.PressureResistance: Internal organs are more accustomed to high pressures.
infotexts.JobDescription.captain: The Commanding Officer is responsible for commanding the entirety of the crew and ensuring that everything is running smoothly.
infotexts.JobDescription.engineer: Engineers are the backbone of a submarine's crew, complementing a mechanic's Mechanical Engineering skill with their knowledge of electrical engineering. They are capable of performing maintenance on the various electrical pieces of the submarine.
infotexts.JobDescription.mechanic: Mechanics are capable of fixing various mechanical devices with their high Mechanical Engineering skill. Together with engineers they ensure a submarine is working to its fullest.
infotexts.JobDescription.securityofficer: Security Officers are responsible for keeping the submarine safe from threats, both external and internal. The creatures inhabiting the ocean aren't the only threat they need to worry about, as several of the renegade groups opposing the Europa Coalition are known to have sent infiltrators on board the vessels.
infotexts.JobDescription.medicaldoctor: Although usually taken for granted, Doctors play an important role on the submarine, possessing the required skill to treat injured or unconscious crew members. Their skills can also be useful for creating various non-medicinal chemicals.
infotexts.JobDescription.assistant: Assistants don't have any specific responsibilities or areas of expertise. This job is a good choice for newcomers who want to get a hang of working on board the submarine without taking up tasks that they aren't qualified for.
infotexts.LocationChange.None.ChangeTo.Outpost: A new outpost has been established at [previousname].
infotexts.LocationChange.None.ChangeTo.Military: A new military outpost has been established at [previousname].
infotexts.LocationChange.None.ChangeTo.Research: A new research outpost has been established at [previousname].
infotexts.LocationChange.Ruins.ChangeTo.Outpost: An outpost has been established at [previousname].
infotexts.LocationChange.Ruins.ChangeTo.Military: A military outpost has been established at [previousname].
infotexts.LocationChange.Ruins.ChangeTo.Research: A research outpost has been established at [previousname].
infotexts.ReactorCommandText: First things first. This sub's power comes from its nuclear reactor and without it, this tub isn't going anywhere. Get your electrical engineer to power on the reactor. He'll take care of the rest for now.
infotexts.ReactorCommandInstructions:
-Find an electrical engineer in the crew list
-Click on "Operate reactor", then "Power up"

(Review instructions by clicking on the objective list on the right)
infotexts.ReactorUseText: This is the reactor. You should leave operating this to a professional, like an engineer. If you want to proceed, there are a couple things you need to know. Keep the fission rate and turbine output balanced, otherwise there will be power shortages or fires. Switch to automatic control if you have to leave the reactor interface.
infotexts.EntityDescription.door: A sliding door with no integrated buttons - has to be wired manually.
infotexts.EntityDescription.windoweddoor: A sliding door with a window. No integrated buttons - has to be wired manually.
infotexts.EntityDescription.hatch: A door, but on the horizontal axis. No integrated buttons - has to be wired manually.
infotexts.SetDefaultBindingsToolTip: Set key bindings to the recommended default settings (left mouse button to select items, right mouse button or esc to deselect).
infotexts.SetLegacyBindingsToolTip: Set key bindings to ones that were used in the old pre-alpha versions of Barotrauma (E to select and deselect items, left mouse button to use item the in hand).
infotexts.Tutorial.TryAgain: Do you want to try again?
infotexts.Tutorial.Radio.Speaker: Captain Huskinson
infotexts.Mechanic.Radio.WakeUp: Are you okay? You need to get up and moving. Get to the sub ASAP!
infotexts.Mechanic.Radio.Equipment: Remember to get your gear from the locker. Grab everything you can carry. We’re in for some rough shit.
infotexts.Mechanic.Radio.Breach: Hey, I’m reading some hull breaches along your way. Better plug those real quick so others stand a chance, too.
infotexts.Mechanic.Radio.News: All right, can you hear me? I got bad news and good news.
infotexts.Mechanic.Radio.Fire: The bad news is there’s a fire ahead. The good news is there’s probably enough scrap nearby for you to fabricate a fire extinguisher.
infotexts.Mechanic.Radio.Diving: You’re almost there. Just be careful, this next leak is large enough for the whole room to be pressurized. Find a diving suit. It should protect your organs against this kind of pressure.
infotexts.Mechanic.Radio.Submarine: Welcome aboard. First thing you need to do is to check the engine and ballast pumps, see if they’re in need of maintenance.
infotexts.Mechanic.Radio.Complete: Well done. Let’s wait for the others to make their way here. Can’t very well operate the sub with just the two of us.
infotexts.Mechanic.OpenDoorObjective: Open door by pushing the adjacent button
infotexts.Mechanic.OpenDoorText: Doors are often wired to be opened via nearby buttons. Interact with buttons by pressing [INTERACTBUTTON] when the cursor is over them.
infotexts.Mechanic.EquipmentObjective: Get your equipment from the locker
infotexts.Mechanic.EquipmentText: Items are stored in containers of different sizes. You can see what’s inside one by interacting with them ([INTERACTBUTTON]). Transfer items between character and container inventory by dragging or double-clicking.\n\nWhen in character’s inventory, items can be equipped by double-clicking on them or by pressing the correct quick-slot key.
infotexts.Mechanic.WeldingText: To repair leaks in hulls, equip the welding tool by double-clicking on it. Some items, like the welding tool, require two free hands to use. Unequip or drop an item by double-clicking it while it is in use.\n\nWhen welding tool is equipped, hold [AIMBUTTON] to aim. While aiming, hold [FIREBUTTON] to weld.
infotexts.Mechanic.DrainObjective: Turn on nearby pump to drain excess water
infotexts.Mechanic.DrainText: When the sub is flooded, use pumps to drain excess water. Usually pumps receive signal from nearby water detectors or navigation terminals but some can be operated manually. This pump is programmed to only pump water out. Turn it on by interacting with it and flip the switch to “on” position.
infotexts.Mechanic.DeconstructText: The fabricator is a machine that can take different kinds of materials and turn them into useful items. In the situation where there’s not enough material for fabrication, items can be broken down in the deconstructor. Just drag the item into one of the top slots and start by pressing the button.\n\nIn this case, fabricating a fire extinguisher requires aluminum and sodium. Sodium is readily available, but aluminum must be deconstructed from oxygen tanks.
infotexts.Mechanic.FabricateText: Now that we have all of the required materials, we can fabricate a fire extinguisher. Find it in the list, load the machine with materials and press the button to start fabricating.\n\nWhen done, the fabricated item can be found in the fabricator’s bottom inventory.
infotexts.Mechanic.ExtinguisherText: Equip the fire extinguisher like you would a welding tool. Then aim by holding down [AIMBUTTON] and dispense by holding down [FIREBUTTON].
infotexts.Mechanic.DropExtinguisherText: Some items, like the fire extinguisher, are too large to carry around in the character’s inventory. To unequip the fire extinguisher, drag it away from the inventory and release the mouse button.
infotexts.Mechanic.DivingText: Diving suit protects the wearer from high pressure. Equip one to be able to swim outside the submarine. Make sure the suit has a full oxygen tank attached, otherwise wearer will suffocate.
infotexts.Mechanic.RepairPumpText: Machines and junction boxes require maintenance. Without it, they will break and stop working. Repair mechanical machines by equipping a wrench and interacting with the broken machine.\n\nItems in need of maintenance are marked with a repair icon.
infotexts.Mechanic.RepairSubmarineObjective: Repair the engine and the ballast pumps
infotexts.Mechanic.RepairSubmarineText: Find the engine (usually located in the rear compartment of a submarine) and ballast pumps (in the bottom, some submarines have multiple ballast tanks).
infotexts.Engineer.Radio.WakeUp: Get your ass up! We need power!
infotexts.Engineer.Radio.Equipment: That last impact cut power to half of the outpost. I want you to grab what you need to get us online again.
infotexts.Engineer.Radio.ReactorStable: We seem to be stable now. Some junction boxes blew their fuses and pumps aren’t working, you should go see what you can do about it.
infotexts.Engineer.Radio.FaultyWiring: Some of the wiring seems to be faulty. Find some wire and do some quick fixing, otherwise we’re without power.
infotexts.Engineer.Radio.ChangeOfPlans: Change of plans. Come to the sub. We’re gonna blow this joint.
infotexts.Engineer.Radio.Submarine: Looks like the electrical room’s seen better days. See if you can get it online, then start up the reactor.
infotexts.Engineer.Radio.Complete: Good work. We may yet make it out of this alive.
infotexts.Engineer.EquipmentText: Items are stored in containers of different sizes. You can see what’s inside one by interacting with them ([INTERACTBUTTON]). Transfer items between character and container inventory by dragging or double-clicking.\n\nWhen in character’s inventory, items can be equipped by double-clicking on them or by pressing the correct quick-slot key.
infotexts.Engineer.ReactorText:
Nuclear reactors provide power to submarines and outposts. They require fuel to create heat and a crewmember to regulate the output.

Drag a fuel rod to the item slot on the left side. Multiple fuel rods create more heat, but in normal circumstances one is enough and any more might lead to overheating.

Start by setting the fission rate so that the needle is on green, then do the same for turbine output. You can see load and output values to the right. Try to keep the output as close to load as possible. When the output is lower, it leads to power outages and when it’s higher, overvoltage and fires.

When the reactor operator leaves the interface, it’s recommended to turn automatic control on. It responds to any fluctuations in grid load, but is considerably slower than a human operator.
infotexts.Engineer.RepairJunctionBoxText: Like mechanical items, junction boxes need maintenance. In addition to wear and tear, they are damaged by water and overvoltage.\n\nThey are repaired using a screwdriver, as opposed to a wrench when fixing mechanical items. Otherwise the process is the same. Equip a screwdriver and interact with the machine to see the repair interface.
infotexts.Engineer.WireJunctionBoxesText: Junction boxes serve as the main way to connect the sub’s machines to the power grid. Connect them with wires to allow the power to travel between them.\n\nTo connect wires to items, equip a screwdriver and wire in separate hands, then click on the item you want to add the wire to. You will see a connection panel with a couple of connection pins and a wire sticking out from the bottom. Drag the wire to “power” pin, then press esc to close the panel. Repeat the step at the next item.
infotexts.Engineer.RepairElectricalRoomText: Find the sub’s electrical room and repair the junction boxes by interacting with them while holding a screwdriver.
infotexts.Engineer.PowerUpReactorText:
Nuclear reactors provide power to submarines and outposts. They require fuel to create heat and a crewmember to regulate the output.

Drag a fuel rod to the item slot on the left side. Multiple fuel rods create more heat, but in normal circumstances one is enough and any more might lead to overheating.

Start by setting the fission rate so that the needle is on green, then do the same for turbine output. You can see load and output values to the right. Try to keep the output as close to load as possible. When the output is lower, it leads to power outages and when it’s higher, overvoltage and fires.

When the reactor operator leaves the interface, it’s recommended to turn automatic control on. It responds to any fluctuations in grid load, but is considerably slower than a human operator.
infotexts.Doctor.Radio.KnockedDown: That was a big one. Are you ok? Get yourself patched up.
infotexts.Doctor.Radio.AssistantBurns: They’ve got a nasty burn. You don’t have any bandages with you, do you? Get them to follow you while you go find some.
infotexts.Doctor.SuppliesText: Items are stored in containers of different sizes. You can see what’s inside one by interacting with them ([INTERACTBUTTON]). Transfer items between character and container inventory by dragging or double-clicking.\n\nWhen in character’s inventory, items can be equipped by double-clicking on them or by pressing the correct quick-slot key.
infotexts.Doctor.FirstAidSelfText: Press [MEDINTERFACEBUTTON] or click your healthbar to enter the medical interface. Afflictions affecting the character are shown to the left, although some afflictions are local to specific limbs. You can inspect different limbs by clicking on them.\n\nTo treat an affliction, drag a medical item onto the highlighted area. Suggested items are shown in the interface, but caution must be exercised, since some characters’ medical skills aren’t high enough to suggest the correct treatment. In this case, you have some light internal damage. Morphine is effective in treating this affliction.
infotexts.Doctor.MedbayObjective: Take the crew member to the med bay.
infotexts.Doctor.MedbayText: Sometimes you will encounter afflictions that you don’t have supplies to treat on the spot. In these situations it’s handy to get the patient to follow you to the med bay, where there are more supplies to treat them.\n\nFind the character in question in the crew list to the left. Then find the “Follow” button and click on it. The character will now follow you until dismissed by clicking on the button again.
infotexts.Doctor.TreatBurnsText: First aid can be administered to other characters, too. Treat them by highlighting the target character and pressing [MEDINTERFACEBUTTON]. The interface will show their status on the left side of the screen.\n\nDrag the correct item into the medical interface to treat the affliction. Remember to select the correct limb before administering treatment. Bandages heal burns quickly.
infotexts.Officer.Radio.WakeUp: Is there any security still alive? We have a hull breach and some unwanted visitors!
infotexts.Officer.Radio.Equipment: Find what you need to take out these monsters.
infotexts.Officer.Radio.CrawlerDead: Good job, but that was just a baby crawler. I’m seeing something bigger up ahead, so keep on your toes.
infotexts.Officer.Radio.SomethingBig: I’m reading something big on the sonar. Load the coilgun and see if you can take it down.
infotexts.Officer.Radio.HammerheadDead: Nice shooting. Bad news is, this station is unsalvageable. Come down to the sub, we’re leaving before it’s too late.
infotexts.Officer.EquipmentText: Items are stored in containers of different sizes. You can see what’s inside one by interacting with them ([INTERACTBUTTON]). Transfer items between character and container inventory by dragging or double-clicking.\n\nWhen in character’s inventory, items can be equipped by double-clicking on them or by pressing the correct quick-slot key.
infotexts.Officer.MeleeWeaponText: Equip a weapon by double-clicking it in your inventory. Weapons require at least one free hand.\n\nReady the weapon by holding [AIMBUTTON] and swing it by clicking [FIREBUTTON].
infotexts.Officer.CrawlerText: Take the crawler down using the stun baton. Stun baton hits inflict stun on the enemies, so use that to your advantage.
infotexts.Officer.SomethingBigObjective: Load coilgun and turn on the supercapacitor
infotexts.Officer.SomethingBigText: Coilguns are standard issue equipment in most subs. They require short bursts of power and boxes of ammunition.\n\nTo make the coilgun ready, you must ensure the supercapacitor has enough power by setting the recharge rate high enough (>50% is usually enough) and insert full ammunition boxes into the coilgun loader.
infotexts.Officer.HammerheadText: To use the coilgun, interact with the periscope. While on the periscope, aim with the mouse and fire by pressing [FIREBUTTON].\n\nThe gun uses a lot of power, so firing conservatively is key. Otherwise the supercapacitor may not be able keep up.
infotexts.CannotRemoveContentPackageSub: Cannot remove the submarine file because it's a part of the content package "[contentpackage]". Please uninstall the content package through the Steam Workshop menu.
infotexts.DoorMsgCannotOpen: This door is controlled with buttons or remote controllers wired to it.
infotexts.EntityDescription.doorwbuttons: A sliding door with two integrated buttons.
infotexts.EntityDescription.windoweddoorwbuttons: A sliding door with a window and two integrated buttons.
infotexts.EntityDescription.hatchwbuttons: A door, but on the horizontal axis. Two integrated buttons.
infotexts.DirectionalVoiceChatToolTip: When enabled, voice chat messages are panned according to the direction of the speaker relative to your position.
infotexts.TraitorRespawnMessage: Your traitor objective was unsuccessful. You are no longer a traitor, so play nice!
infotexts.TraitorTargetMessage: [traitorname] had a secret objective to assassinate you - and the task was successful.
infotexts.KarmaExplanation: Karma reflects the helpful and harmful actions you've done while playing. Actions such as repairing the submarine, operating devices and killing monsters increase Karma, while actions such as attacking members of your crew or damaging the submarine decrease it. If your Karma drops too low, you may not get assigned to certain jobs anymore, or in more extreme cases, you may be banned from the server.
infotexts.KarmaBanWarning: Warning: you will be banned from the server if your Karma decreases below [banthreshold].
infotexts.KarmaBanned: You have been banned from the server because your Karma decreased below [banthreshold].
infotexts.KarmaJobDisallowed: You are not allowed to select this job because your Karma is too low ([yourkarma]/[minkarma]).
infotexts.EntityDescription.alienarmor: A body armor fabricated from an alien metamaterial.
infotexts.EntityDescription.alienhelmet: A helmet fabricated from an alien metamaterial.
infotexts.MissionDescription.salvageskyholderartif: Researchers of [location1] have picked up an infrasonic signal highly similar to those emitted by alien artifacts previously discovered on Europa. Investigate the signal and retrieve the potential artifact.
infotexts.MissionSuccess.salvageskyholderartifactr: The artifact has been successfully retrieved.
infotexts.MissionMessage0.salvageskyholderartifact: The artifact is now on board. Navigate the submarine out of the cavern to claim the reward.
infotexts.MissionDescription.salvagethermalartifac: Researchers of [location1] have picked up an infrasonic signal highly similar to those emitted by alien artifacts previously discovered on Europa. Investigate the signal and retrieve the potential artifact.
infotexts.MissionSuccess.salvagethermalartifactrui: The artifact has been successfully retrieved.
infotexts.MissionMessage0.salvagethermalartifactru: The artifact is now on board. Navigate the submarine out of the cavern to claim the reward.
infotexts.MissionDescription.salvagethermalartifac: Researchers of [location1] have picked up an infrasonic signal highly similar to those emitted by alien artifacts previously discovered on Europa. Investigate the signal and retrieve the potential artifact.
infotexts.MissionSuccess.salvagethermalartifactcav: The artifact has been successfully retrieved.
infotexts.MissionMessage0.salvagethermalartifactca: The artifact is now on board. Navigate the submarine out of the cavern to claim the reward.
infotexts.MissionDescription.salvagenasonovartifac: Researchers of [location1] have picked up an infrasonic signal highly similar to those emitted by alien artifacts previously discovered on Europa. Investigate the signal and retrieve the potential artifact.
infotexts.MissionSuccess.salvagenasonovartifactcav: The artifact has been successfully retrieved.
infotexts.MissionMessage0.salvagenasonovartifactca: The artifact is now on board. Navigate the submarine out of the cavern to claim the reward.
infotexts.MissionDescription.killmoloch: A particularly aggressive Moloch has been terrorizing vessels traveling between [location1] and [location2]. A reward of [reward] credits has been promised to those who kill the creature.
infotexts.MissionMessage0.killmoloch: The moloch is dead. Navigate the submarine out of the cavern to claim the reward.
infotexts.MissionDescription.killtigerthresher: A particularly aggressive Tiger Thresher has been terrorizing vessels traveling between [location1] and [location2]. A reward of [reward] credits has been promised to those who kill the creature.
infotexts.MissionSuccess.killtigerthresher: The Tiger Thresher has been killed.
infotexts.MissionMessage0.killtigerthresher: The thresher is dead. Navigate the submarine out of the cavern to claim the reward.
infotexts.MissionDescription.killhammerhead: A particularly aggressive Hammerhead has been terrorizing vessels traveling between [location1] and [location2]. A reward of [reward] credits has been promised to those who kill the creature.
infotexts.MissionMessage0.killhammerhead: The Hammerhead is dead. Navigate the submarine out of the cavern to claim the reward.
infotexts.MissionDescription.killcrawlerswarm: A large swarm of crawlers has been terrorizing vessels traveling between [location1] and [location2]. A reward of [reward] credits has been promised to those who kill the creature.
infotexts.MissionMessage0.killcrawlerswarm: The swarm is terminated. Navigate the submarine out of the cavern to claim the reward.
infotexts.MissionDescription.killendworm: Seismic readings are indicating that something colossal has emerged from the depths of Europa into the passageway between [location1] and [location2]. All transports through the passageway have been canceled for now and a reward of [reward] has been promised to those who get rid of whatever is causing the seismic activity.
infotexts.MissionSuccess.killendworm: The Endworm is dead and the passageway is open for transport again.
infotexts.MissionMessage0.killendworm: The beast is dead. Navigate the submarine out of the cavern to claim the reward.
infotexts.MissionDescription.salvagekillmoloch: Researchers of [location1] have picked up an infrasonic signal highly similar to those emitted by alien artifacts previously discovered on Europa. Investigate the signal and retrieve the potential artifact.
infotexts.MissionSuccess.salvagekillmoloch: It turns out the signal was emitted by a Moloch. The researchers of [location1] have agreed to pay you the reward nevertheless for getting rid of the Moloch.
infotexts.MissionMessage0.salvagekillmoloch: Turns out the signal was emitted by a Moloch! You should navigate out of the cavern and inform the researchers.
infotexts.MissionDescription.salvagekillcarrier: A small cargo vessel went missing approximately two months ago when transporting xenomaterials from [location1] to [location2]. The vessel was presumed to be taken by the abyss, but now its emergency beacon seems to have been activated near [location2]. Find the vessel and recover the cargo.
infotexts.MissionSuccess.salvagekillcarrier: The researchers of [location2] are eager to know all the details of the encounter, but seem hesitant to answer any questions regarding the vessel. They do however offer you 1000 credits as "reimbursement for your troubles".
infotexts.MissionMessage0.salvagekillcarrier: The missing vessel appears to have been taken over by some sort of parasitic growth and tried to attack your submarine. It seems to be incapacitated now. You should report the incident to [location2].
infotexts.MissionDescription.cargocompoundn: A local arms dealer is offering [reward] credits in exchange for delivering two crates of high explosives to a customer in [location2].
infotexts.MissionSuccess.cargocompoundn: The explosives have been successfully delivered.
infotexts.MissionDescription.cargovolatilecompound: A local arms dealer is offering [reward] credits in exchange for delivering two crates of high explosives to a customer in [location2].
infotexts.MissionSuccess.cargovolatilecompoundn: The explosives have been successfully delivered.
infotexts.MissionDescription.cargochemicals: Reseachers of [location1] need someone to deliver some dangerous chemicals to [location2] for a reward of 250 credits.
infotexts.MissionSuccess.cargochemicals: The chemicals have been successfully delivered.
infotexts.MissionDescription.cargohuskeggs: Local researchers are offering [reward] credits for delivering a container of husk parasite eggs to [location2].
infotexts.MissionSuccess.cargohuskeggs: The husk eggs have been successfully delivered.
infotexts.MissionDescription.cargonitroglycerin: Local researchers are offering 2000 credits for delivering a large amount of nitroglycerin to [location2].
infotexts.MissionSuccess.cargonitroglycerin: The chemicals have been successfully delivered.
infotexts.MissionDescription.cargoclowngear: A local clown syndicate is offering [reward] credits for delivering a shipment of clowning supplies to [location2].
infotexts.MissionSuccess.cargoclowngear: The clown gear has been successfully delivered.
infotexts.MissionDescription.cargoconstructionmine: A consignment of materials for construction needs to be transported to [location2] and the crew chief here is prepared to pay [reward] credits for your trouble.
infotexts.MissionSuccess.cargoconstructionminerals: The materials have been successfully delivered.
infotexts.MissionDescription.cargosecurityminerals: The security team at [location2] needs to be resupplied with materials for weapon fabrication. There's [reward] credits for you if you get these supplies to them.
infotexts.MissionSuccess.cargosecurityminerals: The materials have been successfully delivered.
infotexts.MissionDescription.cargomeditems: A consignment of medical items needs to be transported to [location2]. There's [reward] credits if you can get them there.
infotexts.MissionSuccess.cargomeditems: The materials have been successfully delivered.
infotexts.MissionDescription.cargomeditems: A consignment of medical items needs to be transported to [location2]. There's [reward] credits if you can get them there.
infotexts.MissionSuccess.cargomeditems: The materials have been successfully delivered.
infotexts.MissionDescription.cargomedemergency: A crew member over at [location2] has gone and get themselves a nasty case of morbusine poisoning. They might stand a chance of survival if you can get a shipment of antidote to them ASAP... You'll be paid [reward] credits on delivery.
infotexts.MissionSuccess.cargomedemergency: The antidote has been successfully delivered.
infotexts.MissionDescriptionNeutral.pvpmission: A Coalition vessel has been dispatched from [location1] to destroy a renegade vessel at the outskirts of [location2].
infotexts.MissionDescription1.pvpmission: A renegade vessel has been detected at the outskirts of [location2]. Treason against the Europa Coalition is punishable by death - eliminate the renegades by any means necessary.
infotexts.MissionDescription2.pvpmission: You're a member of a renegade group opposing the Europa Coalition. According to your informants at [location1], a Coalition vessel has just been dispatched on a mission to take down your boat. Eliminate their crew by any means necessary.
infotexts.MissionSuccess.pvpmission: The antidote has been successfully delivered.
